intro: Rhodiola krylovii f. integerrima, commonly known as the Siberian rock rose, is a perennial plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and the Himalayas. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and compact, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer, typically in rocky or alpine environments. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, exhibiting frost resistance and the ability to thrive in poor soil. Its botanical features make it a hardy ornamental plant suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings.
